Articles.Content: I'll get to recoloring the rings so that they look a bit brighter and are easier to see (maybe the same base color as the planet they're owned by).

If you want them to be easier to see, adjust this setting 

color = 0.6,0.5,0.7,**0.584**

Make it a higher number, that number is basically the level of transparency you want, the lower it is, the more you can see thru it.

Here's the new rings!

I think I made the most capable spacecraft in KSP with only using KJR and MechJeb for informational readouts and extremely long burns (the longest burn was 18 minutes!).

I made it to HD101 with plenty of fuel to spare, but the Ion engine I was using mysteriously disappeared.

Hey guys, I just remembered: can we adjust the amount of power HD101 gives off - when I right clicked on the solar panels to check the amount of energy I receive from HD101 I get some really high number near the 100's in terms of energy flow.

Is there any way to fix that?

Yes, just add a node called SolarPowerCurve to your star's config file. There's an example here: [https://github.com/BryceSchroeder/Kopernicus/blob/master/Distribution/KopernicusExamples/Nemesis/Nemesis.cfg#L91](https://github.com/BryceSchroeder/Kopernicus/blob/master/Distribution/KopernicusExamples/Nemesis/Nemesis.cfg#L91)

You probably don't need so many keys though. I think you can get the stock power curve from any solar panel's part config.

Ok, Mr.HappyFace, I found this:

[SigmaBaryCenters](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127820-WIP-1-0-4-Sigma-Binary)!

Do you think we should use it for our binary Gas Giants and all the binary planets/stars (yes, we may add a binary star system that includes a small red dwarf and a K0 star)?

Well, this may be premature, but the next version of Kopernicus might have native support for barycenters, judging by this commit to Kopernicus/development: [https://github.com/BryceSchroeder/Kopernicus/commit/6131a3215dcb4540b930802bad2327b8b63b6fe2](https://github.com/BryceSchroeder/Kopernicus/commit/6131a3215dcb4540b930802bad2327b8b63b6fe2)

Also, how's the fixing of Tyrok going; any news?

I sent Thomas P. the issue and asked him if we were doing anything wrong on Tyrok. I posted the problem on the Kopernicus Dev Page.

He's probably going to answer soon.

amarius1, Thomas P might be able to help with fixing this problem - here's the post: [Tyrok fix?](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649-1-0-x-Kopernicus-Beta-%280-1%29-June-26?p=2062944#post2062944)
